creditline: The Ethel Morrison Van Derlip Fund
medium: Woodblock print (nishiki-e), ink and color on paper
portfolio: Twelve Bouts in the Way of Love (Shikidō torikumi jūniban 色道取組十二番)
text: A woman covers her face with her kimono sleeves her lover looks over his shoulder to see their reflection in a mirror for added narcissistic stimulation. As is the case in most ukiyo-e prints or paintings utilizing a mirror, the reflection depicted would be impossible from that position.
title: Before the Mirror, No. 4 from Twelve Bouts in the Way of Love (Shikidō torikumi jūniban)
